movies.title: Proclaim [2016]
movies.shortDescription:
Good Friday, 1916. James Connolly needs the word to get out, so he tasks Molloy, O'Brien and Brady to print a secret document. It must be ready by Monday...


*Based on the actual characters & events surrounding the secret printing of the first Irish Proclamation.


Director: Maureen O'Connell; Featuring Paul Ward, Daniel Mahony, Brian Murphy, Tim Casey,

movies.title: A Chat with... Marianne March
movies.shortDescription: Marianne March is a stage and screen actor with a wealth of experience across a range of acting disciplines. She met us in Belfast to go over some of her experiences as a TV star and encountering ghosts in Stoke!

movies.title: WilMacca 9 - Dungannon
movies.shortDescription: Objectionable Content: The caustic wit of WilMacca heads up to the top of the Hill of the O'Neills in Dungannon.

movies.title: Day 1350 - Occupying the Land
movies.shortDescription: Outside the small village of Greencastle, protestors have maintained an occupation protest for over four years. We speak to Martin Tracey about the protest and what it means to him and the community.

movies.title: A Chat With... Alan Devers, Headhunters Barber Shop and Railway Museum
movies.shortDescription: You can get a short back and sides like in any other barbers, but the Headhunters Barber Shop & Railway Museum also has a large collection of artefacts from the much-missed trains that served Tyrone and Fermanagh until their closure in the mid twentieth century

movies.title: A Chat With... Marty Hill
movies.shortDescription: Continuing the series following north Belfast GAA club, Pearses, we have A Chat With... Marty Hill to tell us about more of the history of the club.

movies.title: WilMacca 8 - Trillick
movies.shortDescription:
OBJECTIONABLE CONTENT: Samhain Special!

The caustic wit of WilMacca braves the chilling back roads of the Tyrone townlands! Grisly tales of bodysnatchers! surgery gore! Ghosts in a bottle! Michael Jackson!

movies.title: A Chat with... Geordie O'Hara
movies.shortDescription: 1968 Antrim Senior Football Championship winner Geordie O'Hara reminisces about the glory years of the Pearses club, before it was broken up by internment, and forming new teams in 'the cages' of Long Kesh.

movies.title: A Chat With... Rural Queers
movies.shortDescription: On Saturday 25 September, Omagh will host it's inaugural Pride event, with a parade and series of performances. Some of Omagh's rural queers talk about what's on on the day and their experiences being queer in a rural setting.

movies.title: A chat with Lynda Sullivan
movies.shortDescription: Lifelong enviromnmental activist Lynda Sullivan (Firends of the Earth NI) spoke about the impact of resource extraction she witnessed in places like Peru and increasingly here in Ireland.

movies.title: Wilmacca VII (with Marty)
movies.shortDescription: Like the Tyrone panel, Wilma was struck down with Covid - but the show must go on! High Falutin Stunts, Top Quality Props, and Marty.

movies.title: WilMacca Trailer July 2021
movies.shortDescription: Get the caustic wit of WilMacca every month on New Ireland TV. Available free worldwide on Roku and Amazon Fire TV.

movies.title: A chat with... Cat Brogan.mp4
movies.shortDescription: Cat Brogan is an internationally renowned performance poet and activist, originally from Killyclogher. While at the Save Our Sperrins event in Omagh, she chatted about her involvement, connecting with communities through squatting and the importance of the craic!

movies.title: A chat with... Cllr Emmet McAleer
movies.shortDescription: Councillor Emmet McAleer was elected on a platform to bring further scrutiny to the practices of multinational corporations operating in Ireland. Hear him describe the difficulties he has encountered from other elected representatives, and compromised local media.

movies.title: A Chat With... David McCann.mp4
movies.shortDescription: David McCann's debut novel The Green Fella was adapted into an excellent film shown on New Ireland TV. Now that it's got a paperback release, he explains his fascination with the Partition Era.

movies.title: WilMacca 5 Monasterboice
movies.shortDescription: The caustic wit of WilMacca ventured across the provincial border to Leinster, and the round tower of Monasterboice. Hear about banshee protocol, hypnotism, and Wilma's local rant for local people got interrupted by a non local.

movies.title: A Chat With... Linda Ervine MBE
movies.shortDescription: Linda Ervine has been a dedicated proponent of the Irish language from within East Belfast - an area known for it's affinity to British culture.

movies.title: Townland Treasures
movies.shortDescription: The townlands of Ireland hold a rich vein of historical context. In this series, historian and linguist, Malachy McNamee delivers an authorative lesson on the origins of placenames, discussing everything from the nomenclature of Ireland, to the naming of fields.

movies.title: Chatting Sober Part 2: Crowns & Crypto
movies.shortDescription: Back to the Necarne estate in Irvinestown for the second part of Chatting Sober. It was the week of Prince Philip's funeral, and Elon Musk was still showing support for crypto currencies.

movies.title: A Chat With... Roadie TV
movies.shortDescription: Some of the best live performance videos in Ireland are shot by Fintona's Roadie TV. He talks about going 'viral', creating opportunities in a rural economy and hope for the post-Lockdown future.

movies.title: WilMacca 4 - Gortin Lakes
movies.shortDescription: OBJECTIONABLE CONTENT The caustic wit goes out to scenic Gortin Lakes in Tyrone. It was mid-April, it was 2*C outside but the sun was creating a greenhouse effect in the car... that's sure to rile them.

movies.title: A chat with... Marina Hampton
movies.shortDescription: Marina Hampton has been acting in Belfast in a massive range of projects, so it was only right we put her on New Ireland TV. We were finally able to meet up following the partial lifting of Lockdown and the elements were against us but we still had a good chat.

movies.title: A chat with... Andrew McNeill and Thomas Pollock
movies.shortDescription: Frontier Pictures has delivered cracking films to New Ireland TV. Meet the director Thomas Pollock and frequent collaborating actor Andrew McNeill.

movies.title: A Chat With...Brendan Monaghan
movies.shortDescription: Following the success of international hit 39 Days and it's parent album Unbroken, Brendan Monaghan shares some of the wisdom he's picked up from two decades touring the world.

movies.title: Wilmacca 2 - Lover's Retreat, Omagh
movies.shortDescription: OBJECTIONABLE CONTENT. Recorded on the last Saturday of February, prepare for the caustic wit of Wilmacca Conversations. Viewer discretion is recommended.

movies.title: WilMacca 1 - Pigeon Top
movies.shortDescription:
OBJECTIONABLE CONTENT

The first episode Wilmacca Vidcast had some technical issues so we couldn't show the full glory of Pigeon Top, county Tyrone, but there's some of it.

movies.title: Editorial: European Blooper League
movies.shortDescription: The seismic announcement in European football will have lasting effects beyond the football pitch.

movies.title: Club Corner - Na Piarsaigh Part 1
movies.shortDescription: New Series: North Belfast club Na Piarsaigh had their heyday in the 1960s, just as the conflict in Belfast was heating up. But the club is looking to the future now and hoping to build success in 2021.

movies.title: All-Ireland Weekend: Tyrone 2021
movies.shortDescription:
Get the fans' perspective on the Tyrone triumph of 2021. From the Croke Park semi final, the build up around the county, the immediate post match celebrations on the streets of Omagh to the triumphant homecoming of the players to Healy Park.

See who you can spot!

movies.title: Nettle Niceties
movies.shortDescription: The much-maligned nettle has a lot more benefits than it's reputation suggests - inexpensive, natural, chemical-free fertilizer for one.

movies.title: Top Tomatoes: Spring Planting
movies.shortDescription: Tomatoes can be yielded quickly, offering a simple, inexpensive and nutritious foodstuff you can grow in pots out the back.

movies.title: Spud Season: Potato Planting
movies.shortDescription: Consider the potato, one of the most versatile foodstuffs we have. Let's try a different way of planting some.

movies.title: Nollaig :: Santa's Grotty [2018]
movies.shortDescription:
For Nollaig, New Ireland TV presents Santa's Grotty, a heartwarming drama about an impatient wee boy who breaks all the rules in his quest to witness the arrival of Santa Claus, written by Sarah Jane Quinn and directed by PJ Davey.

Starring: Katherine Fox, Robbie Beggs (Robert James), and Brandon Brownlee.
Director of Photography: Frank Corr.
Sound Recording: Chris Roberts. 
Editing / Post Production: Chris Roberts.

movies.title: Riffed [2014]
movies.shortDescription:
Everyone's hurt by the fallout when the Celtic Tiger bit back.

Middling manager Glen is tasked with choosing who to cull from his workforce in Ray Hyland's sardonic comedy.

Featuring Neil Gorman, Alan Buckley, Mark Coney, Clide Delaney, Rebecca Grimes, Brian James Roche, Kenny Stapleton, Orla Tobin

New Ireland TV presents this Red Kremlin production.

movies.title: Red Sauce Comedy
movies.shortDescription:
An eclectic collection of hilarious sketches from the award-winning troupe at Red Sauce Productions!


Objectionable content

movies.title: WilMacca 6 Healy Park
movies.shortDescription: The caustic wit of WilMacca stays close to home this time coming atch from Healy Park, Omagh. Was McAfee a glorious madman, or did he just get too many anti virus popups? And we lift the lid on the Cycle to Work scam.

movies.title: WilMacca 3 - Folk Park Omagh
movies.shortDescription: OBJECTIONABLE CONTENT: Recorded on the last Saturday in March, prepare for the caustic wit of Wilmacca. Featuring US presidential history, geopolitical AI races and what makes a good genius? Tiny primary schools?

movies.title: Father Ted Podcast: The last ever episode
movies.shortDescription: The podders discuss the very last episode of Father, with Muireann McGinty and Dee Harvey. Audio.

movies.title: Editorial: Land Law Logistics
movies.shortDescription: Ireland still operates under a land owning legal structure that was inherited from before partition, giving power to absentee landlords to set ground rents and assigns duties upon leaseholders that exists centuries after the freeholder dies. In this wide ranging editorial, James McAnespy explores some of the more egregious examples of how this is put into practice.

movies.title: Editorial: F's Off
movies.shortDescription: In a wide-ranging editorial, New Ireland TV founder, James McAnespy touches on illegal bonfires, US/UK withdrawal from Afghanistan, SDLP leader Colum Eastwood naming Soldier F, English football hooliganism, and Antrim GAA

movies.title: Editorial: Acht Now
movies.shortDescription: After a tumultous passage, the Irish Language Act finally appears to be getting passed. It is still causing ruptions within Unionism however.

movies.title: Van's Demon Land
movies.shortDescription: Belfast's Van Morrison is beloved worldwide, but he's been getting a bit antsy about Lockdown, and the man he holds responsible - the health minister.

movies.title: Chatting Sober 1: Pharma and Docs
movies.shortDescription: The Chatting Pictures team went to Necarne Estate to discuss matters of pharmacy and medicine in Ireland today.

movies.title: 3000 Antrim Gaels
movies.shortDescription: This week 3000 Antrim Gaels have written to the Taoiseach to press him to further the path to a new Ireland. James McAnespy is among them, he shares his thoughts here.

movies.title: Editorial: Salmon of Knowledge - Cryptocurrency
movies.shortDescription: A new voice on Editorial, as the enigmatic 'Salmon of Knowledge' reacts to the latest cryptocurrency news.

movies.title: Editorial: Unrest in Peace
movies.shortDescription: The death spiral of British imperialism is in its final throes as Brexit reaches it's natural conclusion. This is manifesting itself on the streets.

movies.title: Chatting New Ireland Part 2
movies.shortDescription: We delve deeper into the aspirations for a New Ireland, looking beyond the immediate aftermath of reunification.

movies.title: Editorial: Feck off Facebook
movies.shortDescription: Facebook is embroiled in another scandal, this time they've leaked everyone's names and phone numbers. And not said anything.

movies.title: Chatting New Ireland (Part 1)
movies.shortDescription: OBJECTIONABLE CONTENT: Marty, William and James from Chatting Pictures discuss their aspirations of what a new Ireland could look like.

movies.title: Editorial: World Cup Bid?
movies.shortDescription: A five-team bid to host the FIFA World Cup? Really?

movies.title: Editorial: Omagh
movies.shortDescription: New Ireland TV was founded in Omagh. There's one event that people think of when they hear that word.

movies.title: Editorial: Tech Vulnerabilities
movies.shortDescription: A tiny but eye-opening bug has been discovered in the new Apple computers

movies.title: Editorial: An Uachtaran's Words
movies.shortDescription: An Uachtaran's letter in the Guardian newspaper should open the conversation

movies.title: Editorial - Private Eye Outsells the Observer
movies.shortDescription: Ian Hislop's Private Eye magazine just posted it's best ever sales figures, while the rest of the printed news industry is crumbling - because they aren't afraid of the truth

movies.title: Editorial Celebrity Breakdown
movies.shortDescription: As more lurid personal issues come to light, the age of celebrity culture needs to end

movies.title: Townland Treasures - Body Parts and Abundances.
movies.shortDescription: Malachy McNamee shares more of his research into the placenames of Ireland. He's discovered many places named after body parts, like Gulladuff (black shoulders), or are literal visual descriptions of the landscape like Sligo (abounding with shells).

movies.title: History of Trillick
movies.shortDescription: There's thousands of years of history infused in the earth of the small south Tyrone village of Trillick. Local historian Barney McAnespy takes us from the battle of the O'Neills, up to current generations.

movies.title: Pride Omagh 2021
movies.shortDescription: The first ever Omagh Pride parade took place this weekend. See all the performances from the headlining musicians, all the speeches, interviews with attendees and of course! The parade itself!

movies.title: Save Our Sperrins
movies.shortDescription: The hugely dedicated protesters fighting against the gold mine organised a event in Omagh's town centre. Hear them share their experiences and thoughts on the worst elements of capitalism.

movies.title: North Down Train Journey
movies.shortDescription: Take a journey on the train from Belfast to Bangor

movies.title: Style Guide Depop Tips
movies.shortDescription: Orfhlaith and Bethany offer some great tips and tricks for buying and selling preloved clothes on Depop. Stay stylish and do your bit to help the environment!

movies.title: Fintona Choir Easter 2021
movies.shortDescription: The week leading up to Easter is the most important time of worship in the Christian calendar. The Donacavey parish choir in Fintona had to overcome Lockdown this year.

movies.title: A Mile in Their Shoes - Plumbridge, county Tyrone
movies.shortDescription: At the cusp of the Sperrins, enjoy the surrounds!

movies.title: A mile in their shoes - Gortin Glens, Omagh
movies.shortDescription: Take a meander through the Gortin Glens, Omagh

movies.title: Drive Through - Syonfin Hill Climb
movies.shortDescription: The townland of Syonfin, outside Fintona, hosted one of the fastest events on the Irish motorsport calendar. Let's trace the route!

movies.title: Graves of Donacavey Part 2
movies.shortDescription: Discovering some of the ancient Church of Ireland graves in the Castletown cemetary, in the parish of Donacavey, Fintona

movies.title: A Mile in Their Shoes - Mile one - Drumquin, county Tyrone
movies.shortDescription: Slow TV - a walk through the townlands of Drumquin

movies.title: History - Graves of Donacavey Part 1
movies.shortDescription: A look around the ancient graves of the Old Donacavey Graveyard in Fintona.

movies.title: Making a St Brigids Cross
movies.shortDescription: How to gather the perfect rushes and make a traditional St Brigid's Cross

movies.title: Factual: Irvinestown Air Force Crash
movies.shortDescription: During World War 2, Lough Erne in Fermanagh was a crucial strategic base for the air fleets, but even in this relatively sheltered landing zone, tragedy struck.

movies.title: History - Fintona Credit Union
movies.shortDescription: John Hume described his part in the Credit Union movement in Ireland as one of his proudest achievements. Jim McGurn and others approached him to help establish the Fintona Credit Union Limited.

movies.title: History - Homeplace of Alice Milligan
movies.shortDescription: A look around the homeplace of Alice Milligan, who was one of the most prominent figures in the Gaelic League movement

shortFormVidoes.title: Townland Treasures - Body Parts and Abundances.
shortFormVidoes.shortDescription: Malachy McNamee shares more of his research into the placenames of Ireland. He's discovered many places named after body parts, like Gulladuff (black shoulders), or are literal visual descriptions of the landscape like Sligo (abounding with shells).

shortFormVidoes.shortDescription: Outside the small village of Greencastle, protestors have maintained an occupation protest for over four years. We speak to Martin Tracey about the protest and what it means to him and the community.

shortFormVidoes.shortDescription: Frontier Pictures has delivered cracking films to New Ireland TV. Meet the director Thomas Pollock and frequent collaborating actor Andrew McNeill.
